name: NPR
text:
1/ Oregon was nearly 87% white in 2019. 

But that didn't happen by coincidence.

It began as a whites-only state by design ‚Äî through a series of racist exclusionary laws created to discourage Black people from living there in the first place. (@OPB) https://t.co/5Zt3RPWsve

name: NPR
text:
2/ Oregon was a territory when it passed its first anti-Black exclusionary law in 1844.

It banned slavery ‚Äî but al‚Ä¶ https://t.co/MXWBvC2Wzk

name: NPR
text:
3/ Another anti-Black exclusion law was passed in 1849.

This one barred Black people who were not already in the a‚Ä¶ https://t.co/ggk0CuUTN1

name: NPR
text: 4/ A third exclusion measure came a decade later ‚Äî as a clause in the Oregon Constitution when the territory became‚Ä¶ https://t.co/ryq7VMBAfn

name: NPR
text: 5/ These laws were rarely enforced, but they did what they were created to do: Establish Oregon as a majority-white‚Ä¶ https://t.co/4NR3mfl7wV

name: NPR
text: 6/ These laws were repealed almost a century ago, but the remaining racist language in the state constitution wasn‚Äô‚Ä¶ https://t.co/MBMrKhN5A3

name: NPR
text:
